'''Lileep''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''リリーラ''' ''Lilyla'') is a dual-type {{2t|Rock|Grass}} [[Fossil]] {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It is resurrected from a [[Root and Claw Fossils|Root Fossil]] and [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Cradily}} starting at [[level]] 40.

==Biology==
Lileep is a somewhat plant-like Pokémon with eight dark-tipped, pink tentacles protruding from an opening on top of its head. Inside the pitch black opening are two glowing, yellow eyes. The remainder of its head is purple with yellow eyespots resembling targets. The head is connected to the body by means of a yellow stem. The body itself is purple and semi-spherical. Four stubby roots anchor this Pokémon firmly to the rocks of its home on the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|sea floor}}. 

In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It waves its tentacles around to disguise itself as seaweed in order to attract prey, which is swallowed whole after being entangled. Lileep has been extinct for 100 million years, but specimens can be revived from [[Root and Claw Fossils|Root Fossil]]s.

==In the anime==
[[File:Wales Island Lileep.png|thumb|220px|left|Lileep in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===

===Minor appearances===
A group of Lileep were seen on [[Wales Island]] with the other [[Fossil]] Pokémon in ''[[AG102|Where's Armaldo?]]''. They were being looked after by [[Professor Proctor]] and [[Annie Proctor]].

Three Lileep appeared in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]'' as some of the Pokémon living in the [[Tree of Beginning]].

A Mirage Lileep appeared in ''[[The Mastermind of Mirage Pokémon]]''.

A Lileep revived by [[Dr. Kenzo]] appeared in ''[[DP017|Wild in the Streets!]]'', where it was seen along with several other Pokémon within the habitat created for the revived Pokémon.

==In the manga==
[[File:Lileep and Anorith Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Lileep in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Lileep was set free alongside an {{p|Anorith}} during {{adv|Ruby}}'s stay in [[Fallarbor Town]] in ''[[PS225|Tanks, but No Tanks, Anorith & Lileep]]'', and using the raw talent in battle that he inherited from [[Norman]], he calmed them (when he saw that nobody was looking, of course).

A Lileep appeared as a {{DL|Battle Frontier (Generation III)|Battle Factory}} Pokémon in ''[[PS306|Pinsir Me, I Must Be Dreaming]]''. 

A Lileep appeared in ''[[PS315|Skirting Around Surskit I]]'' as a rental Pokémon that [[Guile Hideout]] stole.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Lileep and its {{p|Cradily|evolution}}.
** Furthermore, Lileep and its evolution consist of the two types with most weaknesses, {{t|Grass}} and {{t|Rock}}, but they have only four weaknesses.
* Lileep and its evolution are the only Grass-type Pokémon that belong in the {{egg3|Water 3}}.

===Origin===
{{Bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Lileep and Cradily}}
It may be based on {{wp|crinoid}}s (also known as sea lilies), marine animals related to {{wp|seastar}}s, which were once believed to be extinct.

===Name origin===
Lileep may be a combination of ''{{wp|lily}}'' and ''peep'' (it seems to peep out from the darkness). The latter part of its name may also derive from ''deep'' (coming from the depths of the ocean floor) or ''sleep'' (as they have been sleeping as Fossils for over one hundred million years).

Lilyla may be a play on ''lily'' and possibly ''lila'' (Spanish for {{wp|Syringa|lilac}}, referring to its purple color).
